\section{Message module}
\label{\detokenize{Message:module-Message}}\label{\detokenize{Message:message-module}}\label{\detokenize{Message::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!Message@\spxentry{Message}}\index{Message@\spxentry{Message}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{Message (class in Message)@\spxentry{Message}\spxextra{class in Message}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Message:Message.Message}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Message.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Message}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{conn\_socket}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{task}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{request}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{box}}}{}
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

This is the class to handle Encryption of messages. The format in which the message is sent to server is determined in this class
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{task}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Task to be done. It can have the values signup, login, send\_message

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{socket}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{socket.socket}}) \textendash{} The socket used for connection with Server

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{request\_content}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}) \textendash{} Content to include in the request to send to server

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{\_data\_to\_send}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}) \textendash{} Contains the data to send to the server

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{\_recvd\_msg}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}) \textendash{} Content recieved from server is stored here

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{box}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{nacl.public.Box}}) \textendash{} Server Public Key and User Private Key

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

Constructor Object
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{conn\_socket}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{socket.socket}}) \textendash{} Socket which has a connection with server

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{task}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Task to do. It can have values: login, signup, send\_message

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{request}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Content to send to server

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{box}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{nacl.public.Box}}) \textendash{} Server Public Key and User Private Key

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

Function to help login into the system. This function sends the login details to the server |

\index{\_recvmsg() (Message.Message method)@\spxentry{\_recvmsg()}\spxextra{Message.Message method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Message:Message.Message._recvmsg}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_recvmsg}}}{}{}
Recieves the information from server. It interprets this as a message from some user and returns the message recieved. The header of recieved request should at least have ‘content’,’content\sphinxhyphen{}type’,’sender’,’content\sphinxhyphen{}length’,’byteorder’,’sender\_e2e\_public\_key’ as the keys
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
The dictionary containing details of message.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
dict

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{app module}

Function to check if the uid is valid. A valid uid is one which has only a\sphinxhyphen{}z,A\sphinxhyphen{}Z,0\sphinxhyphen{}9,\_ characters

\end{description}\end{quote}
